subject: Sales
title: Mobile Commerce Goes Everywhere
description: A 60-second lesson on Mobile Commerce Goes Everywhere.

hook.text: Over half of online purchases now happen on phones. The store lives in your pocket permanently.

buildup.text: Mobile turned every moment into a buying opportunity: commutes, coffee lines, and midnight in bed.

discovery.text: One-tap payments, saved cards, and biometric checkout reduced purchase friction to nearly zero.

twist.text: Mobile also killed attention spans. Sellers have seconds, not minutes, to capture interest on screen.

climax.text: The lesson is clear: if your selling experience doesn't work on a phone, it barely exists at all.

punchline.text: If it doesn't sell on a phone, it barely sells.

quiz.question: What challenge does mobile commerce create for sellers?
options: Phones are too small for shopping
Attention spans are shorter so sellers have only seconds
